summary: The Healthy Food Access for All Americans Act aims to address food deserts by offering tax credits and grants to incentivize investment in grocery stores, food banks, and mobile markets in underserved areas. It establishes a special access food provider credit for grocery stores and a grant program for food banks and temporary access merchants. The bill defines eligibility criteria, including location in a food desert and adherence to specific operational standards. It also mandates updates to the Food Access Research Atlas and authorizes appropriations for the programs.
